response.content:
{
  "step1": "Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8‑inch round baking pan with parchment paper, tap out excess. Cream ½ cup butter and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in 2 eggs, one at a time, then stir in 1 tsp vanilla.",
  "step2": "In a separate bowl whisk together 1 ½ cups all‑purpose flour, ¾ cup unsweetened cocoa powder, 1 tsp baking powder, ½ tsp baking soda, and ¼ tsp salt. Add ¾ cup whole‑milk, ½ cup sour cream, and ½ cup boiling water, mixing until smooth.",
  "step3": "Combine the dry mixture with the wet batter. Fold gently until just combined, being careful not to over‑mix. Pour batter into prepared pan, tapping lightly on the counter to release air bubbles. Bake 30‑35 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out mostly clean.",
  "step4": "While cake cools, whisk together 3 oz bittersweet chocolate, ¼ cup heavy cream, 1 tbsp butter, and pinch of salt. Heat over low, stirring until smooth. Let cool to room temperature before stirring in 2 tbsp powdered sugar to thicken slightly.",
  "step5": "Once the cake is cool, level the top with a knife if needed, then cut into eight equal wedges. Spread a thin layer of chocolate ganache over each wedge, allowing excess to drip down the sides. Let set until firm.",
  "step6": "Optional: Decorate with fresh berries or shaved chocolate for an elegant finish. Serve at room temperature or slightly chilled. Enjoy a rich, moist chocolate cake perfect for eight guests."
}
